title: 🎯 Standing Arm Jump
description:
◣◥  New Syllabus Challenge!

🎯 Standing Arm Jump

Climbing Challenge - Arm-Jump 1

Demonstrate a standing arm-jump (aka Cat-Leap) from 4-steps (heel-to-toe) away, onto a chest-height wall or higher.

Landing with knees bent, one leg higher than the other. One at hip-height, and underneath you. Landing feet first, then hands.

Arms must be bent on landing. Full finger length over the top. No overgrip onto the back edge of the wall - must be on the front edge corner of the wall.

Hold for 3 seconds.

Repeat three times on each leg landing high, the other low.

Takeoff two feet from the jump. You cannot lean in without a jump into the arm-jump.

-- Rules of Challenge --

Rule 1 description : The height of the wall must be chest-height or greater.
Rule 2 description : Must takeoff from4-steps away.
Rule 3 description : Both sides must be performed. In regards to the foot that is high on the wall.
Rule 4 description : Three repetitions on each side (6 reps in total).
Rule 5 description : Landing staggered with the feet. One high, one low. Feet land first, than hands.
Rule 6 description : Takeoff two feet.
Rule 7 description : Full Finger length must be over front edge. Arms must be bent.
